incident.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead

Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toUpperCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toLowerCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the `android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES` javadoc for details.

A newer version of com.android.application than 8.0.2 is available: 8.12.2

Fixed screen orientations will be ignored in most cases, starting from Android 16. Android is moving toward a model where apps are expected to adapt to various orientations, display sizes, and aspect ratios.
Insecure Base Configuration
Set `android:baselineAligned="false"` on this element for better performance
Possible overdraw: Root element paints background `#000000` with a theme that also paints a background (inferred theme is `@style/Theme.AppCompat.DayNight`)
Buttons in button bars should be borderless; use `style="?android:attr/buttonBarButtonStyle"` (and `?android:attr/buttonBarStyle` on the parent)
Buttons in button bars should be borderless; use `style="?android:attr/buttonBarButtonStyle"` (and `?android:attr/buttonBarStyle` on the parent)
Use version catalog instead (androidx.appcompat:appcompat is already available as `androidx-appcompat`, but using version 1.7.1 instead)
